specialRules.title: Void Shields
description: Each Void Shield will automatically stop one point of damage and then go down. Do not make armour saves for damage stopped by Void Shields, nor allocate Blast Markers. Once all of the shields have been knocked down, the unit may be damaged normally and you may make saving throws against any hits that are scored. Hits from close combat ignore void shields but units using their firefight values must first knock down any shields before they can damage the unit.
The number of Void Shields each War Engine has is noted on the unit’s datasheet.

Each time a formation with Void Shields regroups (either by doing a Hold or a Marshal Action) roll one d6 for each Starting Damage Capacity of the unit(s) with Void Shields. For each roll of 6, one of that unit's lost Void Shields is restored.
In addition, each unit with Void Shields regains one lost Void Shield in the End Phase.

specialRules.title: God Machine
description: War Engines with a starting Damage Capacity of 8 or more are subject to the God Machine special rule.

The magnificence of these awe-inspiring constructs comes at a price, for if such an incarnation of power were to falter or be destroyed, the forces that are there to aid them would become greatly disturbed.

For this reason, whenever a unit with God Machine special rule is broken, all friendly formations suffer 1 BM. Whenever a unit with God Machine special rule is destroyed, all friendly units suffer D3+1 BMs.
Units with the God Machine special rule are themselves immune to this effect.

specialRules.title: Split Fire
description: War Engines with a starting Damage Capacity of 8 or more may declare that they will Split Fire when attempting to perform a Sustain Fire or Advance Action. If successful, the WE may fire at up to two enemy formations, but may not target more than one formation per individual weapon. If Split Fire is performed, the WE gets no +1 to-hit modifier if performing a Sustain Fire, and suffers a -1 to hit if doing an Advance.

specialRules.title: Independent
description: Allows a Warhound Pack to operate as two independent War Engines for all purposes, including for determining the army BTS. If one Warhound is destroyed, the other one in the pack receives a Blast Marker

unit.name: Imperator Titan
specialRules: *Leg Bastions*: May transport up to ten infantry units without Jump Packs or Mounted
unit.notes: May step over units and pieces of terrain that that are lower lower than the unit’s knees and less than 2cm wide.
unit.crit: The unit’s plasma reactor has been breached. Roll a D6 for each breach on the unit in the end phase of each turn. On a roll of 1 the unit is destroyed and all units within 5cm suffer a hit on a roll of 5+, and on a roll of 4–6 the breach has been repaired. Any breach not repaired causes one point of damage.
